result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Seth A. Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Special disposition under 973.015 if probation on Count 3 is successfully completed, complies with all treatment recommended and all fines/costs/surcharges paid in full.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Seth A. Berry

records.addlTxt: termintated - regular

2:51 p.m. Defendant Seth A. Berry in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. 
Also calling 15cf143 - Deferred agreement review. Defendant states he is still on probation - If defendant has substantially complied - State moves to dismiss - Granted. Adj. 2:55 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2018 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Mr. Berry made $19.00 payment to COC - Assessment Report provided to Mr. Berry and also sent to DOC
Defendant had paid $400 online.. applied to this case and sent balance to DOC
Attachment to plea questionnaire
Defense Exhibit 1 - Sentencing Hearing
DPA filed
No contact with DKO and underage females.

9:07 a.m. Defendant Seth A. Berry in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Seth A. Berry in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. in 15cf143 State moves to amend Count 1 on Information to a violation of 948.09 Sexual Intercourse with a Child - Class A Misdemeanor  and to amend Information to add a Count - violation of 961.41(3g)(e) Possession of THC - A Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss 14cm405 - Granted.  Voorhees has provided copy of psycho-sexual exam report - Michlig/Court in receipt of report. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea to remaining Counts.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty on Counts 1 and new Count as amended in Information in 15cf143 and 15cm267. Court accepts defendant's plea in Count 2 of 15cf143 and accepts Deferred agreement.  Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. Michlig states victim impact packets were sent in both cases - nothing was returned. Voorhees presents psycho-sexual exam as Exhibit 1 - received - Court orders document to be sealed/confidential.
Court Sentence
In 15cf143
Count 1
Jail - 8 months
Jail Credit - 201 days
CC

In 15cf143  Count 3 and 15cm267
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Continue mental health treatment and counseling 
ADHD treatment
Sexual offender counseling as directed by PO
AODA assessment and recovery including in-patient treatment if recommended
Obtain/Maintain full-time employment/student status
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Special disposition under 973.015 if probation is successfully completed, complies with all treatment recommended and all fines/costs/surcharges paid in full.
In 15cf143  - Cash bail modified to $10,000 signature bond. 
Appeal rights given
Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm. Adj. 10:09 a.m.

2:24 p.m. Defendant Seth A. Berry in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Seth A. Berry in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cm405, 15cm267 and 15cf143. Michlig statement to compliance with victim rights. Michlig/Voorhees statement to resolution-request adjournment. Adj. 2:30 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for temporary release
State's Reply to Discovery continued
3rd Motion to Modify Bail

2:50 p.m. Defendant Seth A. Berry in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Seth A. Berry in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cm405, 15cm367 and 15cf143. Court in receipt of Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail. Michlig statement to bond modification. Court denies motion to amend cash bond. Court grants request for purpose of attending evaluation in Madison on November 23, 2015 - Court allows release for purpose of attending examination to one or both of parents at 7:00 on November 23, 2015 to be returned to jail by 7:00 a.m. the following day. All other conditions of bond will remain in place. Voorhees will check with jail to ascertain if written order is necessary for release. Adj. 2:57 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

3:53 p.m. Defendant Seth A. Berry in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15 cf143, 14cm405, 15cm267.  Voorhees states has received partial discovery and will request approval for psycho/sexual eval. Voorhees will be filing pre-trial motions before next pre-trial conference. Adj. 3:57 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 03:57 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:59 pm - Defendant Seth A. Berry in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Seth A. Berry in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cm405 (STC), 15cm267(AIA) and 15cf143 (ARGN).  In case 15cf143 - State files Information.  Voorhees in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  In case 15cm267 - Voorhees in receipt of complaint, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Voorhees statement to bond modification in the near future.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Adjourned 04:08 p.m.
No contact with DKO and underage females.  If unable to post cash, may attend inpatient treatment at Koinonia.

04:08 pm - Defendant Seth A. Berry in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cm405, 15cm267 and 15cf143.  State calls RPD Detective Joshual Chiamulera/Sworn/Direct by Michlig Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Voorhees.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Voorhees filed motion to modify bond on today's date.  Michlig states does not have motion in file.  Voorhees provides copy to Michlig.  Michlig/Voorhees statement to motion.  Court amends bond to allow inpatient treatment at Koinonia.  In 15cm267 - Voorhees requests AIA be held at time of the arraignment in case 15cf143.  In case 14cm405 - DPA was not filed - Case remains open.  Will track with other case.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
to modify bond

01:23 pm - Defendant Seth A. Berry in court, via video,  with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Seth A. Berry in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm267 (Initial) and 15cf143 (AIA).  In case 15cm267 - Voorhees in receipt of complaint - Complaint for defendant to be faxed to the jail.  Voorhees requests adjourned initial appearance in new case.  Michlig/Voorhees to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Defendant now in receipt of criminal complaint in case 15cm267.  In 15cf143 - Voorhees/Michlig statement to motion to modify bond.  Currently set at $5,000 with conditions.  Court denies motion.  Set for preliminary hearing.  Case 14cm405 to track with these cases - remains in open status - DPA was not filed.  Bail continued.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 04:00 pm.  Adjourned 01:36 pm
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-01-2015 01:15 pm
from Atty Voorhees requesting new date for AIA.
No contact with DKO and underage females.

Judge O'Melia on behalf of Judge Bloom.  Defendant Seth A. Berry in court, in custody via video.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek Public Defender.  Court questions defendant.  Michlig statement to bail states no contact with DKO.  Court sets $5000 cash Bond and no contact with underage females  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
